name: Andromeda Elite Helmet
html: This special-issue Andromeda Initiative helmet is custom designed for explorers who excel in the Initiative training programs taken on prior to departing for Andromeda. Its Pathfinder-grade construction is strong enough to protect the wearer from the dangers of unexplored space while remaining light enough to allow full mobility.

name: Angaran Arms
html: This armor integrates angaran hardware with Initiative software, resulting in a sturdy hardsuit that utilizes technologies unique to the Heleus Cluster. Various adjustments have been made to the design to accommodate non-angaran biology.

name: Angaran Chestpiece
html: This armor integrates angaran hardware with Initiative software, resulting in a sturdy hardsuit that utilizes technologies unique to the Heleus Cluster. Various adjustments have been made to the design to accommodate non-angaran biology.

name: Angaran Helmet
html: This armor integrates angaran hardware with Initiative software, resulting in a sturdy hardsuit that utilizes technologies unique to the Heleus Cluster. Various adjustments have been made to the design to accommodate non-angaran biology.

name: Angaran Legs
html: This armor integrates angaran hardware with Initiative software, resulting in a sturdy hardsuit that utilizes technologies unique to the Heleus Cluster. Various adjustments have been made to the design to accommodate non-angaran biology.

name: Archon Visor
features: As an action, gain 1d4 worth of power slots or tech points. You canâ€™t use this property again until you finish a long rest.
html: The Archon visor uses an efficient algorithm to balance processing power for omni-tools. A heads-up display and voice command software allows users to micromanage the systems, reducing the cool-down period between energy expenditures.

name: Asari Initiate Armor
features: While wearing this armor, your cantrips are considered to be 1 step higher in their progression. For example, a 1st level player casts a cantrip as if they were at the 5th level. 5th -> 11th. 11th -> 17th. There is no additional effect at the 17th level.
html: Standard issue armor for all Asari infantry. Build-in biotic amps provide a minor boost to biotic powers.

name: Assassin Armor
features: As an action, you can activate a tactical cloak, becoming invisible. The cloak lasts 1 minute or until you make an attack, cast a power, use a grenade or mine, or fire a heavy weapon. You may use this feature once per short rest.
html: Elkoss Combine was commissioned by the Salarian Tactics Group to make a set of armor that would allow their agents to remain unseen and unheard.

name: Batarian Talon Gauntlets
features: Add 1 point of Slashing damage to all melee damage rolls. Advantage on Intimidation skill checks.
html: A set of spiked, clawed gauntlets that give the appearance of their wearer possessing demonic hands.

name: Blood Dragon Armet
features: You regain 1d4 worth of power slots or tech points when you take a short rest.
html: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance.

name: Blood Dragon Curiass
html: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance. The chest and shoulder piece bears the logo of the Edmonton Blood Dragons, and the inside of the armor bears the signatures of the entire team.

name: Blood Dragon Greaves
features: +1 bonus to power attack rolls and power saving throw DCs.
html: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance.

name: Blood Dragon Vambraces
features: +1 bonus to power attack rolls and power saving throw DCs.
html: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance.

name: BT Suit
features: You can regain 2d4 tech points every short rest.
html: Equipped with a full battle telemetry system to increase Omni-tool power efficiency.

name: Capacitor Helmet
features: +1 AC. Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.
html: A recent design, this Alliance-made helmet stores micro capacitors in its structure to replenish spent kinetic barriers. The transpari-plast armor panel on its top can be removed to access capacitors for field maintenance.

name: Cerberus Ajax Gauntlets
html: Among Cerberus soldiers, Ajax armor is favored by those brave or unlucky enough to lead charges to break enemy formations. Its role is to keep the wearer standing and shooting as long as possible. It offers some benefit to omni-tool and biotic amp systems, but its main emphasis is boosting and recharging its kinetic barrier and bleeding off weapon heat through coolant circulation in its gloves.

name: Cerberus Ajax Greaves
html: Among Cerberus soldiers, Ajax armor is favored by those brave or unlucky enough to lead charges to break enemy formations. Its role is to keep the wearer standing and shooting as long as possible. It offers some benefit to omni-tool and biotic amp systems, but its main emphasis is boosting and recharging its kinetic barrier and bleeding off weapon heat through coolant circulation in its gloves.

name: Cerberus Ajax Helmet
html: Among Cerberus soldiers, Ajax armor is favored by those brave or unlucky enough to lead charges to break enemy formations. Its role is to keep the wearer standing and shooting as long as possible. It offers some benefit to omni-tool and biotic amp systems, but its main emphasis is boosting and recharging its kinetic barrier and bleeding off weapon heat through coolant circulation in its gloves.

name: Cerberus Ajax Vest
html: Among Cerberus soldiers, Ajax armor is favored by those brave or unlucky enough to lead charges to break enemy formations. Its role is to keep the wearer standing and shooting as long as possible. It offers some benefit to omni-tool and biotic amp systems, but its main emphasis is boosting and recharging its kinetic barrier and bleeding off weapon heat through coolant circulation in its gloves.

name: Cerberus Assault Armor
html: Cerberus assault armor is designed for shock troops, who are expected to turn the tide of battle against creatures or forces that would decimate normal soldiers. The troops demanded three things in its design: shields and armor thick enough to last against a superior foe, and compartments for extra thermal clips. The only drawback of the armor is its weight, which the troops carry as a point of pride. They have a saying: "Out of shape going in, in shape coming out."

name: Cerberus Assault Helmet
html: Cerberus assault armor is designed for shock troops, who are expected to turn the tide of battle against creatures or forces that would decimate normal soldiers. The troops demanded three things in its design: shields and armor thick enough to last against a superior foe, and compartments for extra thermal clips. The only drawback of the armor is its weight, which the troops carry as a point of pride. They have a saying: "Out of shape going in, in shape coming out."

name: Cerberus Nightmare Boots
html: Nightmare armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms expecting long-range conflicts. Powerful capacitors deliver punishing energy to the Phantom's weapons, and circulating coolant in its gloves allows for more shots before a given thermal clip overheats. The remaining energy focuses on shield strength and regeneration time to help survivability.

name: Cerberus Nightmare Chestpiece
features: Increase your thermal clip capacity by 4.
html: Nightmare armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms expecting long-range conflicts. Powerful capacitors deliver punishing energy to the Phantom's weapons, and circulating coolant in its gloves allows for more shots before a given thermal clip overheats. The remaining energy focuses on shield strength and regeneration time to help survivability.

name: Cerberus Nightmare Gloves
features: Equipped weapons have increased heat equal to twice the weapon's base heat.
html: Nightmare armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms expecting long-range conflicts. Powerful capacitors deliver punishing energy to the Phantom's weapons, and circulating coolant in its gloves allows for more shots before a given thermal clip overheats. The remaining energy focuses on shield strength and regeneration time to help survivability.

name: Cerberus Nightmare Helmet
features: +1 bonus to melee weapon attack and damage rolls.
html: Nightmare armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms expecting long-range conflicts. Powerful capacitors deliver punishing energy to the Phantom's weapons, and circulating coolant in its gloves allows for more shots before a given thermal clip overheats. The remaining energy focuses on shield strength and regeneration time to help survivability.

name: Cerberus Shade Armguards
features: +1 bonus to melee weapon attack and damage rolls
html: Cerberus Shade armor is worn by Phantoms who need to be prepared for a wide variety of threats. Its capacitors give modest boosts to shields and shield regeneration time. Many small improvements increase the performance of biotic amps and omni-tools, heat management and kinetic coils for ranged weapons, and synthetic muscle assistors for melee capability.

name: Cerberus Shade Chestpiece
html: Cerberus Shade armor is worn by Phantoms who need to be prepared for a wide variety of threats. Its capacitors give modest boosts to shields and shield regeneration time. Many small improvements increase the performance of biotic amps and omni-tools, heat management and kinetic coils for ranged weapons, and synthetic muscle assistors for melee capability.

name: Cerberus Shade Helmet
features: +1 bonus to power attack and damage rolls
html: Cerberus Shade armor is worn by Phantoms who need to be prepared for a wide variety of threats. Its capacitors give modest boosts to shields and shield regeneration time. Many small improvements increase the performance of biotic amps and omni-tools, heat management and kinetic coils for ranged weapons, and synthetic muscle assistors for melee capability.

name: Cerberus Shade Legguards
html: Cerberus Shade armor is worn by Phantoms who need to be prepared for a wide variety of threats. Its capacitors give modest boosts to shields and shield regeneration time. Many small improvements increase the performance of biotic amps and omni-tools, heat management and kinetic coils for ranged weapons, and synthetic muscle assistors for melee capability.

name: Cerberus Spirit Armor
html: Spirit armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms fortunate enough to be biotic or for those who are skilled enough to use highly technical attacks. The armor has small gains for shield strength and regeneration, but where it truly shines is in its capacity to amplify biotic amps and omni-tools. These attacks hit significantly harder and more often, allowing the Phantom to dismantle heavily-armored targets.

name: Cerberus Spirit Helmet
features: When you roll a 1 or a 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech power, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
html: Spirit armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms fortunate enough to be biotic or for those who are skilled enough to use highly technical attacks. The armor has small gains for shield strength and regeneration, but where it truly shines is in its capacity to amplify biotic amps and omni-tools. These attacks hit significantly harder and more often, allowing the Phantom to dismantle heavily-armored targets.

name: Collector Carapace
html: The Collectors' chitinous armor is flexible and even tougher than ballistic fibers. Its organic construction allows it to be self-healing, and the muscle-like tissue that assists movement ensures it is comfortable to wear despite its weight. This suit was originally adapted out of salvaged Collector technology by Cerberus and is incredibly difficult to find on the galactic market.

name: Collector Headpiece
html: The Collectors' chitinous armor is flexible and even tougher than ballistic fibers. Its organic construction allows it to be self-healing, and the muscle-like tissue that assists movement ensures it is comfortable to wear despite its weight. This suit was originally adapted out of salvaged Collector technology by Cerberus and is incredibly difficult to find on the galactic market.

name: Colossus Chestplate
html: A bulky, heavy armor set that is difficult to wear for those not in superior shape. But considered the galaxy's best defensive suit.

name: Colossus Gauntlets
html: A bulky, heavy armor set that is difficult to wear for those not in superior shape. But considered the galaxy's best defensive suit.

name: Colossus Greaves
html: A bulky, heavy armor set that is difficult to wear for those not in superior shape. But considered the galaxy's best defensive suit.

name: Colossus Helmet
html: A bulky, heavy armor set that is difficult to wear for those not in superior shape. But considered the galaxy's best defensive suit.

name: Crisis Armor
features: Required STR is 14 instead of 16. You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.
html: Crisis Armor is manufactured by Jormangund Technology, a rising star of post-contact human industry. The armor is lightweight but provides incredible protection.

name: Death Mask
features: +1 on melee attack and damage rolls
html: Developed by Tyriel Advanced Communications Corporation (TACC), the latest version of the Death Mask offers exceptional protection and real-time data feedback that helps coordinate the wearer's melee attacks.

name: Deep Space Explorer Armor
features: Resistance to cold and fire damage.
html: The Andromeda Initiative's mission is one of discovery and exploration, as well as colonization. Readying personnel to journey into harsh environments-and even the void of space was always part of the plan. Thus, the Initiative's custom Deep Space Explorer (DSE) hardsuit is equipped with multiple environment seals, failsafes, a hefty liquid oxygen supply, a formidable kinetic barrier generator, and an array of scientific instruments. Although many were built, most were mysteriously lost en route to Andromeda.

name: Deep Space Explorer Helmet
features: Darkvision <me-distance length='25' />. Infrared Vision <me-distance length='25' />. You can toggle between the 2 vision types as a free action.
html: The Andromeda Initiative's mission is one of discovery and exploration, as well as colonization. Readying personnel to journey into harsh environments-and even the void of space was always part of the plan. Thus, the Initiative's custom Deep Space Explorer (DSE) hardsuit is equipped with multiple environment seals, failsafes, a hefty liquid oxygen supply, a formidable kinetic barrier generator, and an array of scientific instruments. Although many were built, most were mysteriously lost en route to Andromeda.

name: Delumcore Overlay
features: You roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a ranged weapon attack.
html: Developed by Delumcore Systems, a VI inside this headgear enhances aim when targeting an enemy's vulnerable points.

name: Duelist Armor
features: Once per long rest, if you fall below 0 hit points you immediately become stabilized.
html: Duelist armor was originally commissioned to Elanus Risk Control systems for use in cage fighting and other live-action combat sports. The armor focuses on keeping the wearer alive after a fatal wound because managers were tired of losing so many fighters in the ring. The armor is as light as fabric and allows full range of motion.

name: Elanus Goliath Gauntlets
features: Advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.
html: Arm plating with micro servos that coordinate muscle movements when resistance is encountered.

name: Enviro-Greaves
features: Advantage on Athletics checks made to swim or climb.
html: A set of leg armor that makes the user much more maneuverable in a mountainous or aquatic environment with normally unsuitable terrain.

name: Freedom Armor
html: Cerberus designed freedom armor to look and feel like standard clothing while providing protection to their agents.

name: Gladiator Armor
html: Elkoss Combine's Gladiator Armor is a simple upgrade to most heavy armor.

name: GUARDIAN Gauntlets
features: When you are forced to make a saving throw from a heavy weapon attack that required targeting, you may use your reaction to reduce the damage done to you to 0. You may use this feature once per long rest.
html: Arm gauntlets that contain power cells that fuel a miniature version of a starship's standard GARDIAN point defense lasers.

name: Hahne-Kedar Tactical Armor
features: When wearing this armor, treat your Strength ability score as if it were 19 for the purposes of carrying equipment (unless your score is higher, then no effect occurs).
html: A chest plate that disperses weight in a way that makes carrying more equipment bearable.

name: Heleus Armor
html: This hardsuit is the ultimate product of Initiative research into Heleus Cluster species. Remnant power sources supply angaran hardware in a frame made possible by kett bio-enhancements and Pathfinder implants. This armor is unequivocally a combat suit, intended for the defense of Initiative and angaran colonies

name: Heleus Helmet
html: This hardsuit is the ultimate product of Initiative research into Heleus Cluster species. Remnant power sources supply angaran hardware in a frame made possible by kett bio-enhancements and Pathfinder implants. This armor is unequivocally a combat suit, intended for the defense of Initiative and angaran colonies

name: Hoplite Armor
html: With additional research into kinetic barrier devices, Cerberus Skunkworks created the Hoplite Armor. As light and simple as their popular Freedom Armor with a shield generator around the waist, giving it an appearance of ancient Greek hoplites.

name: HyperGuardian Chestplate
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.
html: HyperGuardian hardsuits were built by Kassa Fabrication as a civilian-friendly alternative to the Colossus line intended for private security in heavy-fire situations or extreme environmental conditions. The Initiative considered the bulky and unbreakable HyperGuardian a perfect choice for protecting vulnerable new colonies.

name: HyperGuardian Gauntlets
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.
html: HyperGuardian hardsuits were built by Kassa Fabrication as a civilian-friendly alternative to the Colossus line intended for private security in heavy-fire situations or extreme environmental conditions. The Initiative considered the bulky and unbreakable HyperGuardian a perfect choice for protecting vulnerable new colonies.

name: HyperGuardian Greaves
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.
html: HyperGuardian hardsuits were built by Kassa Fabrication as a civilian-friendly alternative to the Colossus line intended for private security in heavy-fire situations or extreme environmental conditions. The Initiative considered the bulky and unbreakable HyperGuardian a perfect choice for protecting vulnerable new colonies.

name: HyperGuardian Helmet
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.
html: HyperGuardian hardsuits were built by Kassa Fabrication as a civilian-friendly alternative to the Colossus line intended for private security in heavy-fire situations or extreme environmental conditions. The Initiative considered the bulky and unbreakable HyperGuardian a perfect choice for protecting vulnerable new colonies.

name: Inferno Armor
features: +1 bonus to power attack rolls and power saving throw DCs.
html: Built specifically for Cerberus field officers, the Inferno armor has a VI dedicated to recognizing signs of stress and medical trauma. This application helps assess soldiers but can be useful in any high-risk situations. The Inferno's microframe computer also manages biotic amp and omni-tool power, and microservos help the wearer's movements to counteract the armor's weight.

name: Inferno Helmet
features: +1 bonus to power attack rolls and power saving throw DCs.
html: Built specifically for Cerberus field officers, the Inferno armor has a VI dedicated to recognizing signs of stress and medical trauma. This application helps assess soldiers but can be useful in any high-risk situations. The Inferno's microframe computer also manages biotic amp and omni-tool power, and microservos help the wearer's movements to counteract the armor's weight.

name: Initiative Chestpiece
html: Standard-issue Andromeda Initiative hardsuits are designed for exploration as much as combat, combining jump-jets, high-grade external and internal sensors, and a variety of atmospheric filters with the usual kinetic barrier generators and ceramic armor plating. Personnel equipped in these suits can enter and leave alien biomes without fear of contamination or hostile wildlife.

name: Initiative Gauntlets
html: Standard-issue Andromeda Initiative hardsuits are designed for exploration as much as combat, combining jump-jets, high-grade external and internal sensors, and a variety of atmospheric filters with the usual kinetic barrier generators and ceramic armor plating. Personnel equipped in these suits can enter and leave alien biomes without fear of contamination or hostile wildlife.

name: Initiative Greaves
features: Your jump distance is tripled. If you jump straight up, you can hover at the apex of your jump until the start of your next turn, at which point, you fall slowly back to the ground, taking half of your movement speed for this turn.
html: Standard-issue Andromeda Initiative hardsuits are designed for exploration as much as combat, combining jump-jets, high-grade external and internal sensors, and a variety of atmospheric filters with the usual kinetic barrier generators and ceramic armor plating. Personnel equipped in these suits can enter and leave alien biomes without fear of contamination or hostile wildlife.

name: Initiative Helmet
features: Infrared Vision <me-distance length='25' />. Darkvision <me-distance length='25' />. You can toggle between the 2 vision types as a free action.
html: Standard-issue Andromeda Initiative hardsuits are designed for exploration as much as combat, combining jump-jets, high-grade external and internal sensors, and a variety of atmospheric filters with the usual kinetic barrier generators and ceramic armor plating. Personnel equipped in these suits can enter and leave alien biomes without fear of contamination or hostile wildlife.

name: Kestrel Helmet
html: The Kestrel armor system's helmet forgoes traditional transparent visors in favor of a reinforced faceplate with an internal heads-up display. The display connects to redundant micro cameras to allow naturalistic vision inside the well-padded interior.

name: Kett Chestplate
features: Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
html: Although this hardsuit's basic materials-ceramic armor plating and kinetic padding-are Initiative standard, kett biotech permeates the overall design and feeds directly into the user's nervous system. Kett armor enhances combat prowess through chemical regulation and stimulation.

name: Kett Greaves
html: Although this hardsuit's basic materials-ceramic armor plating and kinetic padding-are Initiative standard, kett biotech permeates the overall design and feeds directly into the user's nervous system. Kett armor enhances combat prowess through chemical regulation and stimulation.

name: Kett Helmet
features: +1 bonus to melee weapon attack and damage rolls.
html: Although this hardsuit's basic materials-ceramic armor plating and kinetic padding-are Initiative standard, kett biotech permeates the overall design and feeds directly into the user's nervous system. Kett armor enhances combat prowess through chemical regulation and stimulation.

name: Kett Vambraces
features: +1 bonus to melee weapon attack and damage rolls.
html: Although this hardsuit's basic materials-ceramic armor plating and kinetic padding-are Initiative standard, kett biotech permeates the overall design and feeds directly into the user's nervous system. Kett armor enhances combat prowess through chemical regulation and stimulation.

name: Kuwashii Visor
features: As a bonus action, you choose a creature you can see within <me-distance length='75' />. For the next minute, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to the target whenever you hit it with a weapon attack, and you have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check you make to find it. You can use this feature 3 times per long rest.
html: Developed by Ariake Technologies, the wearer exchanges full protective coverage for visibility, unencumbered mobility, and increased accuracy.

name: Liberator Armor
html: Devlon Industries' Liberator Armor is a simple upgrade to most light armor.

name: Lockdown Greaves
features: As a bonus action, the wearer can activate the effect of the greaves to stick to the surface they are walking on, provided it's made of metal. This can aid them in walking up walls, upside down, etc. If the surface is metal, the user is immune to being lifted, otherwise, they have advantage on saving throws against being lifted. The effect lasts for 1 minute and can only be used once per short rest.
html: A pair of leg armor pieces that connect the wearer's boots to the suit's power supply, turning the boots into a powerful electromagnet.

name: Mantis Armor
features: Whenever you hit a target with a melee weapon attack, you may use your reaction to activate your armor's switchblades, dealing an additional 1d6 slashing damage to the target. If you use your reaction this way, you may then use your bonus action to attempt to grapple the target. You have advantage on the Strength (Athletics) check.
html: Hahne-Kedar's line of armor that utilizes arm-length, serrated switchblades in the greaves meant to hook targets. Don't cut yourself!

name: Maverick Boots
html: There's nothing elegant about this patchwork hardsuit. It mixes various materials and technology from the Heleus Cluster and its microframe computer runs a jumble of barely linked programs. Despite this, or because of it, the armor is highly effective in combat, with targeting and thermal distribution systems second to none.

name: Maverick Vest
html: There's nothing elegant about this patchwork hardsuit. It mixes various materials and technology from the Heleus Cluster and its microframe computer runs a jumble of barely linked programs. Despite this, or because of it, the armor is highly effective in combat, with targeting and thermal distribution systems second to none.

name: Maverick Visor
html: There's nothing elegant about this patchwork hardsuit. It mixes various materials and technology from the Heleus Cluster and its microframe computer runs a jumble of barely linked programs. Despite this, or because of it, the armor is highly effective in combat, with targeting and thermal distribution systems second to none.

name: Maverick Wraps
html: There's nothing elegant about this patchwork hardsuit. It mixes various materials and technology from the Heleus Cluster and its microframe computer runs a jumble of barely linked programs. Despite this, or because of it, the armor is highly effective in combat, with targeting and thermal distribution systems second to none.

name: Mercenary Armor
html: Basic armor offering a minor upgrade to shield capacitors.

name: Mnemonic Visor
features: When you roll a 1 damage die for an attack you make with a biotic power, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
html: Relatively new to the market, the Mnemonic Visor is difficult to find outside Alliance space. Intended for biotic specialists, this headpiece plugs into the rest of the user's suit, gathering data so it can adapt to the wearer's tactics. It boosts biotic performance at critical moments to allow a soldier to perform with greater power than normally possible.

name: N7 Chestplate
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with medium armor.
html: Interlocking plates of thick, ablative ceramic plates. Designed to be light, effective, and easily repaired.

name: N7 Defender Armorsuit
html: The Defender Armor is a variation on the N7 Special Forcesâ€™ combat gear, built to protect soldiers in long-running engagements where reinforcements may be sparse. When the wearer fires a weapon, the suit's computers divert energy from the main power cell to the gun's kinetic coils, offering an extra punch. The Defender's storage compartments are designed to hold spare thermal clips, while capacitors throughout the armor provide extra power to shields during critical moments in battle. The armor also comes with an injection system built into the suit and neural-linked bio-monitors that help adjust the wearer's breathing rate and adrenaline levels.

name: N7 Defender Helmet
html: The Defender Armor is a variation on the N7 Special Forcesâ€™ combat gear, built to protect soldiers in long-running engagements where reinforcements may be sparse. When the wearer fires a weapon, the suit's computers divert energy from the main power cell to the gun's kinetic coils, offering an extra punch. The Defender's storage compartments are designed to hold spare thermal clips, while capacitors throughout the armor provide extra power to shields during critical moments in battle. The armor also comes with an injection system built into the suit and neural-linked bio-monitors that help adjust the wearer's breathing rate and adrenaline levels.

name: N7 Gauntlets
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with medium armor.
html: A combination of fabric armor with kinetic padding and plates of ablative ceramic for protection.

name: N7 Greaves
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with medium armor.
html: Dual layer of fabric armor and kinetic padding beneath thick plates of ablative ceramic and lined with additional kinetic barriers.

name: N7 Helmet
features: You have advantage on initiative rolls. You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with medium armor.
html: Dual layer of fabric armor and kinetic padding within a lightweight ablative ceramic shell. Comes standard with a suite of communication, navigation, and battlefield awareness software.

name: Onyx Armor
html: Onyx Armor is one of Aldrin Labs' armor lines and used by Alliance special forces personnel. A minor upgrade to stock medium armor.

name: Partisan Armor
html: Batarian State Arms developed a line of armor meant to protect Batarian soldiers for alien diseases and infections.

name: Partisan Helmet
html: Batarian State Arms developed a line of armor meant to protect Batarian soldiers for alien diseases and infections.

name: Pathfinder Chestpiece
html: Pathfinder hardsuits are heavily modified from the Initiative suit baseline, foregoing certain scientific instruments in favor of added combat capability. The role of a Pathfinder includes threat neutralization, and improved stabilizers and targeting controls help ensure they can protect his or her team.

name: Pathfinder Gauntlets
features: When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
html: Pathfinder hardsuits are heavily modified from the Initiative suit baseline, foregoing certain scientific instruments in favor of added combat capability. The role of a Pathfinder includes threat neutralization, and improved stabilizers and targeting controls help ensure they can protect his or her team.

name: Pathfinder Greaves
features: Your jump distance is tripled. If you jump straight up, you can hover at the apex of your jump until the start of your next turn, at which point, you fall slowly back to the ground, taking half of your movement speed for this turn.
html: Pathfinder hardsuits are heavily modified from the Initiative suit baseline, foregoing certain scientific instruments in favor of added combat capability. The role of a Pathfinder includes threat neutralization, and improved stabilizers and targeting controls help ensure they can protect his or her team.

name: Pathfinder Helmet
html: Pathfinder hardsuits are heavily modified from the Initiative suit baseline, foregoing certain scientific instruments in favor of added combat capability. The role of a Pathfinder includes threat neutralization, and improved stabilizers and targeting controls help ensure they can protect his or her team.

name: Power Reservoir Legguards
features: As a reaction to having 0 barrier ticks, restore all of your barrier ticks. You may use this ability once per long rest.
html: A set of greaves that have batteries designed to conserve biotic power.

name: Predator Armor
features: Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit
html: Standard issue armor for Turian infantry. The interlocking plates provide increased protection against potentially fatal wounds.

name: Reckoner-Knight Armet
features: Whenever you lose hit points, you may use your reaction to expend one medi-gel (provided you have any medi-gel remaining).
html: The Reckoner-Knight armor was originally worn by the winners of Earth's Urban Combat Championship 2186, the Rhode Island Knights. A military-grade version of this equipment was presented to longtime Knight fans at the Alliance's Rhode Island base, in thanks for their passionate (and vocal) support during the EUCC championship matches. Beneath this armor's medieval-gothic facade lie a host of biofeedback systems intended to monitor the wearer's health and combat performance. Micro-servos maximize damage done in close-quarters combat, while a beefed-up power cell feeds energy into weapons systems to increase projectile velocity. Befitting gear originally designed for a full-contact sport, a sophisticated shield system also offers the wearer solid protection from incoming attacks.

name: Reckoner-Knight Armorsuit
features: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.
html: The Reckoner-Knight armor was originally worn by the winners of Earth's Urban Combat Championship 2186, the Rhode Island Knights. A military-grade version of this equipment was presented to longtime Knight fans at the Alliance's Rhode Island base, in thanks for their passionate (and vocal) support during the EUCC championship matches. Beneath this armor's medieval-gothic facade lie a host of biofeedback systems intended to monitor the wearer's health and combat performance. Micro-servos maximize damage done in close-quarters combat, while a beefed-up power cell feeds energy into weapons systems to increase projectile velocity. Befitting gear originally designed for a full-contact sport, a sophisticated shield system also offers the wearer solid protection from incoming attacks.

name: Recon Hood
features: Infrared Vision <me-distance length='150' />. Darkvision <me-distance length='150' />. You can toggle between vision types as a free action.
html: A hood issued to covert action teams, this model's optic display interfaces with most small arm's auto-targeting software, linking hand and eye for improved accuracy and increased weapon damage. Ballistic-mesh fabric and composite ceramic plating provide necessary armor, and the integral air filter helps in hostile environments.

name: Remnant Battery
html: This armor was designed from scratch by the Initiative using Remnant technology. Its servos, microframe computer, and kinetic barrier generators are all dependent on Remnant science and artifacts. This resilient and regenerative hardsuit has an energy surplus, though its internal systems can be difficult to properly monitor.

name: Remnant Helmet
features: Darkvision <me-distance length='50' />. Infrared Vision <me-distance length='50' />. You may toggle between vision types as a free action.
html: This armor was designed from scratch by the Initiative using Remnant technology. Its servos, microframe computer, and kinetic barrier generators are all dependent on Remnant science and artifacts. This resilient and regenerative hardsuit has an energy surplus, though its internal systems can be difficult to properly monitor.

name: Remnant Tasset
features: Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.
html: This armor was designed from scratch by the Initiative using Remnant technology. Its servos, microframe computer, and kinetic barrier generators are all dependent on Remnant science and artifacts. This resilient and regenerative hardsuit has an energy surplus, though its internal systems can be difficult to properly monitor.

name: Remnant Vambraces
html: This armor was designed from scratch by the Initiative using Remnant technology. Its servos, microframe computer, and kinetic barrier generators are all dependent on Remnant science and artifacts. This resilient and regenerative hardsuit has an energy surplus, though its internal systems can be difficult to properly monitor.

name: Rosenkov Reflex Armor
features: Once per short rest, you may take 2 reactions within a single turn.
html: Sturdy armor that gathers real-time battle telemetry and and onboard combat computer that can help a combatant move faster than they can think.

name: Rosenkov Snaring Gauntlets
features: You are immune to dropping your weapon if hit by any effect that would otherwise disarm you.
html: Arm pieces that were designed with trench warfare in mind, they have strong electromagnets that prove especially useful when regulated by combat computers.

name: Scavenger Armor
features: You have 2 additional weapon slots (or increase your carry capacity by 20kg).
html: The Auto-Recycling Technical and Combat Interface Armor-a name only slightly less awkward in the original turian-is better known as the Scavenger Hardsuit. Originally built by Armax Arsenal in the Milky Way, the Scavenger incorporates quarian technology that allows the user to better analyze, interface, and integrate foreign components.

name: Scavenger Helmet
features: You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) and Intelligence (Science) rolls when analyzing objects.
html: The Auto-Recycling Technical and Combat Interface Armor-a name only slightly less awkward in the original turian-is better known as the Scavenger Hardsuit. Originally built by Armax Arsenal in the Milky Way, the Scavenger incorporates quarian technology that allows the user to better analyze, interface, and integrate foreign components.

name: Securitel Helmet
features: Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit
html: The Securitel Helmet was originally designed as riot-gear. It is covered in ablative plating, well-padded to lessen damage from shocks, blows and bullet impacts. The helmet's emitters boost shielding in the rest of the armor, while its onboard computers monitor the wearer's heart-rate and central nervous system.

name: Sentry Interface
features: Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.
html: This visor works with the Sentry system, a software application that optimizes an armor suit's microframe computer. When the Sentry system is running, more power can be devoted to shield management.

name: Serrice Adaptor Gauntlets
features: Every long rest, you can designate a type of damage except bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. You gain resistance to it until you take another long rest.
html: A pair of gauntlets that have micro fabricators in their frames. These can spread omni-gel through the rest of the hardsuit, inuring the combatant to a type of damage.

name: Serrice Rimebane Armor
html: Chest plating with auxiliary power cells that defrost spots of crystalline ice caused by cryo rounds on impact.

name: Sirta Parade Armor
features: Advantage on Persuasion and Performance checks.
html: Glossy armor that shines in the light, designed to look good as its first function.

name: Skirmish Armor
features: Increase your walking speed by <me-distance length='10' />.
html: Batarian State Arms' Skirmish armor provides enhanced speed to better escape the blast of the grenade you just threw.

name: Stealth Greaves
features: While you wear these greaves, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Stealth checks that rely on moving silently.
html: Greaves that secrete a highly advanced lubricant in the joints.

name: Stock Heavy Armor
html: A cheap and simple set of heavy armor.

name: Stock Light Armor
html: A cheap and simple set of light armor.

name: Stock Medium Armor
html: A cheap and simple set of medium armor.

name: Strider Legguards
features: Increase your walking speed by <me-distance length='15' />.
html: Greaves that use a set of mass effect field generators to alter the wearer's gravity, making certain maneuvers much more manageable.

name: Survivor Armor
html: A simple set of armor made by Devlon Industries providing moderate protection.

name: Terminus Assault Chestpiece
html: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.

name: Terminus Assault Gauntlets
features: +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls
html: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.

name: Terminus Assault Greaves
features: Increase your walking speed by <me-distance length='10' />.
html: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.

name: Terminus Assault Helmet
html: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.

name: Titan Armor
html: Titan armor was created by Rosenkov Materials as an upgrade to their other lines of heavy armor.

name: Umbra Visor
features: You gain a +2 bonus to power attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your powers.
html: A next-generation night-vision device that assists targeting. By detecting the focal point of the wearer's eyes and enhancing the image at that location, the visor helps direct a biotic power or a shot from an omni-tool exactly where the wearer is looking.

name: Ursa Armor
html: Hahne-Kedar's Urse armor is known for its "think hide", and is a moderate update over stock armor.

name: Warlord Armor
features: Resistance to slashing and bludgeoning damage.
html: A favorite for Krogran gladiators. The armor is finished with a silver polish, which quickly becomes dented, scuffed, and bloodied. These "battle scars" tell the tale of a Krogan's feats.
